abstract: The $75 million settlement between the S.E.C. and Citigroup involves the bank’s failure to adequately disclose its exposure to subprime mortgage debt.
snippet: The $75 million settlement between the S.E.C. and Citigroup involves the bank’s failure to adequately disclose its exposure to subprime mortgage debt.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge said Friday that she would accept the $75 million settlement between the Securities and Exchange Commission and Citigroup over the bank’s failure to adequately disclose its exposure to subprime mortgage debt in 2007, The New York Times’s Edward Wyatt reports from Washington.
